snippet: A powerful 8.6-magnitude earthquake, followed by a strong aftershock, struck off Indonesia on Wednesday, creating panic and reviving memories of the deadly 2004 earthquake.
abstract: Two powerful earthquakes strike about two hours apart off the coast of Sumatra, spreading panic among residents of the Indonesian island and reviving memories of the devastating 2004 earthquake and tsunami in the same area; there are no reports of casualties or significant damage, and the tsunami warnings are called off after a few hours.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Muktita Suhartono and Poypiti Amatatham from Bangkok; Nikhila Gill, Sruthi Gottipati and Nida Najar from New Delhi; Kevin Drew from Hong Kong; and J. David Goodman from New York.

lead_paragraph: A powerful 8.6-magnitude earthquake, followed by a strong aftershock, struck off Indonesia on Wednesday, creating panic and reviving memories of the deadly 2004 earthquake.

headline.seo: Strong Indonesian Earthquake Prompts Tsunami Warning
headline.main: Quakes Set Off Panic Among Indonesians, but No Tsunami in Indian Ocean
headline.print_headline: Strong Earthquakes Prompt Tsunami Fears Among Indonesians
